comments.body: You can't drop the key like this. You have to remove the line where `.conda-smithy/travis.token` is created

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +29,33 @@
        # Add the TRAVIS_TOKEN environment variable for the "conda-forge-manager" Travis user.
        # - secure: ""

comments.body: We should be able to have `sudo: false` regardless, right? Admittedly I don't think it matters much for macOS, but still. Also it shows up below.
`sudo: false` is there to select which type of linux container. Not used for`OSX at all
Right. Though we do have `sudo: false` a few lines below already. Maybe we should drop one of these lines.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +10,14 @@    - if: (fork IN (false)) AND (NOT (type IN (pull_request)))
      os: linux
      sudo: false

sudo: false

comments.body: @jakirkham [There is no 6.1 image!](https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/languages/objective-c/#Supported-Xcode-versions) We would have to use `beta-xcode6.1`!
Beat me to it by 5 seconds, @patricksnape.

Was wondering about this, but it seems to have worked for other people. Will try adding a beta in a new PR.

xref: https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/6522#issuecomment-251766410

Also raised an upstream issue about erroring out builds where `osx_image` refers to a non-existent image.

xref: https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/6684

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +3,7 @@
os: osx
osx_image: xcode6.1

sudo: false

comments.body: FYI. Seems we are not the only people doing [this](https://github.com/grosser/travis_dedup/blame/041373bbe8e07cfa76b5ce96bc21e0d9fe077471/Readme.md#L37).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +19,23 @@
        # Add the TRAVIS_TOKEN environment variable for the "conda-forge" Travis user.
        - secure: ""
